intro: Sphaeralcea rusbyi var. gilensis, commonly known as Gil's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its globular shape and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, known for its showy flowers and fibrous stems.
